name: 01-Project Overview
content:
Telco Customer Segmentation

Project Overview

Objective:

The primary goal of this project is to segment telecom customers into distinct groups based on their demographics, service usage, and behavioral characteristics. This segmentation allows the company to develop targeted marketing strategies, optimize product offerings, improve retention, and enhance customer experience.

Approach:

The project uses a structured data science workflow:

  1. Data Profiling & EDA – Understand the distribution of customer usage, revenue, churn, and demographics.
  2. Data Preparation – Clean and preprocess telecom usage data, engineering features relevant for segmentation.
  3. Clustering & Prediction – Apply K-means clustering to group customers into meaningful clusters, and save the model for predicting new customer segments.
  4. Cluster Profiling & Deep Analysis – Perform detailed profiling of clusters (revenue, usage, churn patterns) and conduct category-based deep segmentation.
  5. Actionable Insights – Generate insights for marketing, retention, and network optimization strategies.

Significance:

Customer segmentation in telecom is critical to:

  • Retain high-value customers by predicting churn-prone groups.
  • Tailor services and pricing models to match specific customer needs.
  • Optimize resource allocation across different customer bases.
  • Enable cross-selling and up-selling opportunities.

Benefits:

  • Increased customer retention and reduced churn.
  • Higher revenue through targeted offers and optimized pricing.
  • Enhanced customer satisfaction with personalized service.
  • Identification of new market opportunities through under-served segments.

Expected Outcomes:

  • Well-defined customer clusters with distinct behavioral and demographic characteristics.
  • Predictive capability to assign new customers to segments in real time.
  • Analytical dashboards highlighting monthly revenue, call patterns, churn risks, and retention trends by segment.
